contentItemData.description: Provides an overview and hyperlinks to all packaged documentation.
contentItemData.label: Documentation Index

contentItemData.description: Reviews performing radio frequency physical layer evaluation with EFR32BG SoCs and BGM modules using the Direct Test Mode protocol in Bluetooth SDK v3.x.
contentItemData.label: AN1267: Radio Frequency Physical Layer Evaluation in Bluetooth SDK v3.x

contentItemData.description: Introduces non-volatile data storage using flash and the three different storage implementations offered for Silicon Labs microcontrollers and SoCs: Simulated EEPROM, PS Store, and NVM3.
contentItemData.label: UG103.07: Non-Volatile Data Storage Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Contains detailed information on configuring and using the Secure Boot with hardware Root of Trust and Secure Loader on Series 2 devices, including how to provision the signing key. This is a companion document to UG266: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide.
contentItemData.label: AN1218: Series 2 Secure Boot with RTSL

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Discusses the latest changes to the The Real-Time Locating (RTL) library, including added/deleted/deprecated APIs, and lists fixed and known issues.
contentItemData.label: Bluetooth Real-Time Locating Library Release Notes

contentItemData.description: Reviews using this XML-based mark-up language to describe the Bluetooth GATT database, configure access and security properties, and include the GATT database as part of the firmware.
contentItemData.label: UG118: Blue Gecko Bluetooth Profile Toolkit Developer's Guide

contentItemData.description: Describes the four multiprotocol modes, discusses considerations when selecting protocols for multiprotocol implementations, and reviews the Radio Scheduler, a required component of a dynamic multiprotocol solution.
contentItemData.label: UG103.16: Multiprotocol Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Describes the software components provided by Silicon Labs to support Direction Finding (DF) and provides instructions on how to start developing your own application.
contentItemData.label: QSG175: Silicon Labs' Direction Finding Solution Quick-Start Guide

contentItemData.description: Describes methods to improve the coexistence of 2.4 GHz IEEE 802.11b/g/n Wi-Fi and other 2.4 GHz radios such as Bluetooth, Bluetooth Mesh, Bluetooth Low Energy, and IEEE 802.15.4-based radios such as Zigbee and OpenThread.
contentItemData.label: UG103.17: Wi-Fi Coexistence Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Thread

contentItemData.description: Contains a comprehensive list of APIs used to interface to the Silicon Labs Bluetooth stack.
contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Bluetooth API Reference Guide

contentItemData.description: Describes using Simplicity Studio 5's Network Analyzer to debug Bluetooth Mesh and Low Energy applications. It can be read jointly with AN958: Debugging and Programming Interfaces for Customer Designs for more information on using Packet Trace Interface with custom hardware.
contentItemData.label: AN1317: Using Network Analyzer with Bluetooth Low Energy and Mesh

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh

contentItemData.description: Describes how to measure the power consumption of EFR32BG devices running the Bluetooth i-Beacon example. For general instructions, see AN969: Measuring Power Consumption in Wireless Gecko Devices, available on silabs.com.
contentItemData.label: AN1246: EFR32BG SoC Bluetooth Smart Device Power Consumption Measurements

contentItemData.description: Describes the sample applications provided to demonstrate the directing finding capabilities of Bluetooth 5.1. Angle of Arrival (AoA) estimation is demonstrated with the use of Silicon Labs' Real Time Locating (RTL) library. These techniques are applicable to the EFR32MGx and EFR32BGx series.
contentItemData.label: AN1296: Application Development with Silicon Labs' RTL Library

contentItemData.description: Gives a short overview of the standard Host Controller Interface (HCI) and how to use it with a Silicon Labs Bluetooth LE controller.
contentItemData.label: AN1328: Enabling a Radio Co-Processor using the Bluetooth Controller and HCI Functions

contentItemData.description: Includes detailed information on using the Gecko Bootloader with Silicon Labs Bluetooth applications. It supplements the general Gecko Bootloader implementation information provided in UG266: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide.
contentItemData.label: AN1086: Using the Gecko Bootloader with Silicon Labs Bluetooth Applications

contentItemData.description: How to securely "wrap" keys in EFR32 Series 2 devices with Secure Vault, so they can be stored in non-volatile storage.
contentItemData.label: AN1271: Secure Key Storage

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Describes how to lock and unlock the debug access of EFR32 Gecko Series 2 devices. Many aspects of the debug access, including the secure debug unlock are described. The Debug Challenge Interface (DCI) and Secure Engine (SE) Mailbox Interface for locking and unlocking debug access are also included.
contentItemData.label: AN1190: Series 2 Secure Debug

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Describes the Wi-Fi impact on Bluetooth and methods to improve Bluetooth coexistence with Wi-Fi. Explains design considerations to improve coexistence without direct interaction between Bluetooth and Wi-Fi radios. These techniques are applicable to the EFR32MGx and EFR32BGx series. Discusses the Silicon Labs Packet Traffic Arbitration (PTA) support to coordinate 2.4GHz RF traffic for co-located Bluetooth and Wi-Fi radios.
contentItemData.label: AN1128: Bluetooth Coexistence with Wi-Fi

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh

contentItemData.description: Describes using the Simplicity Studio 5 IDE and tools for application development with Bluetooth SDK v3.x.
contentItemData.label: QSG169: Bluetooth SDK v3.x Quick Start Guide

contentItemData.description: Explains how NVM3 can be used as non-volatile data storage in various protocol implementations.
contentItemData.label: AN1135: Using Third Generation Non-Volatile Memory (NVM3) Data Storage

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Describes how to implement a dynamic multiprotocol solution.
contentItemData.label: UG305: Dynamic Multiprotocol User's Guide

property.value: Bluetooth Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Details on programming, provisioning, and configuring Series 2 devices in production environments. Covers Secure Engine Subsystem of Series 2 devices, which runs easily upgradeable Secure Engine (SE) or Virtual Secure Engine (VSE) firmware.
contentItemData.label: AN1222: Production Programming of Series 2 Devices

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: How to program, provision, and configure the anti-tamper module on EFR32 Series 2 devices with Secure Vault.
contentItemData.label: AN1247: Anti-Tamper Protection Configuration and Use

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Explains the basics of Bluetooth Angle of Arrival (AoA) and Angle of Departure (AoD) direction finding technologies and provides the theory behind estimating angle of arrival.
contentItemData.label: UG103.18: Bluetooth Direction Finding Fundamentals

contentItemData.description: Introduces bootloading for Silicon Labs networking devices. Discusses the Gecko Bootloader as well as legacy Ember and Bluetooth bootloaders, and describes the file formats used by each.
contentItemData.label: UG103.06: Bootloader Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Describes how to provision and configure Series 2 devices through the DCI and SWD.
contentItemData.label: AN1303: Programming Series 2 Devices Using the Debug Challenge Interface (DCI) and Serial Wire Debug (SWD)

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: Describes how to use the Simplicity Studio 5 GATT Configurator, an intuitive interface providing access to all the Profiles, Services, Characteristics, and Descriptors as defined in the Bluetooth specification.
contentItemData.label: UG438: GATT Configurator User's Guide for Bluetooth SDK v3.x

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh

contentItemData.description: Provides details on how to develop a dynamic multiprotocol application running Bluetooth and a proprietary protocol on RAIL in GSDK v3.x.
contentItemData.label: AN1269: Dynamic Multiprotocol Development with Bluetooth and Proprietary Protocols on RAIL in GSDK v3.x

contentItemData.description: Introduces the security concepts that must be considered when implementing an Internet of Things (IoT) system. Using the ioXt Alliance's eight security principles as a structure, it clearly delineates the solutions Silicon Labs provides to support endpoint security and what you must do outside of the Silicon Labs framework.
contentItemData.label: UG103.05: IoT Endpoint Security Fundamentals

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread Z-Wave HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: How to authenticate an EFR32 Series 2 device with Secure Vault, using secure device certificates and signatures.
contentItemData.label: AN1268: Authenticating Silicon Labs Devices using Device Certificates

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit

contentItemData.description: A detailed overview of the changes, additions, and fixes in the Gecko Platform components. The Gecko Platform includes EMLIB, EMDRV, RAIL Library, NVM3, and the component-based infrastructure.
contentItemData.label: Gecko Platform Release Notes

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread Z-Wave 32-bit\ MCU HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Offers an overview for those new to the Bluetooth low energy technology.
contentItemData.label: UG103.14: Bluetooth LE Fundamentals

contentItemData.description: Describes how to integrate a v3.x Silicon Labs Bluetooth application with an RTOS, and demonstrate how a time- and event-driven application can be run in parallel with the Bluetooth stack.
contentItemData.label: AN1260: Integrating v3.x Silicon Labs Bluetooth Applications with Real-Time Operating Systems

contentItemData.description: Describes the high-level implementation of the Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader for EFR32 SoCs and NCPs, and provides information on how to get started using the Gecko Bootloader with Silicon Labs wireless protocol stacks.
contentItemData.label: UG266: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Contains a comprehensive list of APIs used to interface to the Silicon Labs Bluetooth Real-Time Locating Library.
contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Bluetooth RTL Library API Reference Guide

contentItemData.description: Covers the Bluetooth stack v3.x architecture, application development flow, using the MCU core and peripherals, stack configuration options, and stack resource usage.
contentItemData.label: UG434: Silicon Labs Bluetooth C Application Developer's Guide for SDK v3.x

contentItemData.description: Lists compatibility requirements and sources for all software components in the development environment. Discusses the latest changes to the Silicon Labs Bluetooth SDK and associated utilities, including added/deleted/deprecated features/API, and lists fixed and known issues.
contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Bluetooth Release Notes

contentItemData.description: Describes the differences between using Bluetooth SDK v2.x in Simplicity Studio 4 and using Bluetooth SDK v3.x in Simplicity Studio 5. Outlines the steps needed to migrate a v2.x project to v3.x.
contentItemData.label: AN1255: Transitioning from the v2.x to the v3.x Bluetooth SDK

contentItemData.description: Describes how to integrate crypto functionality into applications using PSA Crypto compared to Mbed TLS.
contentItemData.label: AN1311: Integrating Crypto Functionality Using PSA Crypto Compared to Mbed TLS

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Describes how to configure the NCP target and how to program the NCP host when using the Bluetooth Stack in Network Co-Processor mode
contentItemData.label: AN1259: Using the v3.x Silicon Labs Bluetooth Stack in Network Co-Processor Mode

contentItemData.description: Describes how and when to use Simplicity Commander's Command-Line Interface.
contentItemData.label: UG162: Simplicity Commander Reference Guide

property.value: Bluetooth Bluetooth\ Mesh Zigbee Proprietary Thread HomeKit Wi-SUN

contentItemData.description: Bluetooth 5.1 makes it possible to send Constant Tone Extensions (CTEs) in Bluetooth packets on which phase measurements can be done. This guide is for those implementing custom applications that take advantage of phase measurement and antenna switching capabilites.
contentItemData.label: AN1297: Custom Direction-Finding Solutions using Silicon Labs' Bluetooth Stack
